sub_title: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning
summary:
German expat. Based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. Curious and resilient communications leader with exceptional skills in both strategy development and implementation, international project management, cross-team collaboration, stakeholder alignment and relationship building. Extensive experience advising leaders of multinationals, tech start-ups and scale-ups, and some of the foremost privately owned businesses across Europe. 

Supporting business leaders with developing and implementing effective stakeholder experiences. Focus on cultural transformations aimed at improving organisational health. Constantly challenging existing mental models, relationships, and taken-for-granted ways of operating as well as organisational roles and formal structures, strategies, goals and objectives. 

As author of the book The Employee Journey – How to create a great employee experience, I aim to inspire leaders to create great employee experiences for their organisations, while the book itself was nominated as one of the best Dutch management books of 2019.

The work my teams and I have implemented over the years has received wide recognition within the HR, Marketing and Communications industry and I have won and been nominated for many leading industry awards. In 2020, I was named ‘Logeion Communications Professional of the Year’, a prestigious title awarded by the professional body for the Dutch communications industry. The award recognises professionals who have made an outstanding contribution to the field.

My personal mission is to shape the future of work and create a better, healthier future for everyone.

projects.title: Aegon - Global strategy rollout/ employee engagement program
projects.description:
For Aegon, we went back to the key insights underpinning the company’s strategy. Among these were that customers want a more personal and relevant service. That a 150-year history can be a strength and not just a weakness. That adapt or die is the new business mantra. That innovative and disruptive business models are being introduced every day. That the market now demands a pro-active and agile approach.

The result is FutureFit. Rolling out this year, it’s is a journey in three stages – Touch, Tell, Sell (adapted from the McKinsey consumer decision model) – that aims to engage employees at the emotional, rational and practical levels. It’s a journey in which Aegon stimulates and invites staff to use their imagination to think about a bigger picture and a bolder purpose. One in which we explain the differences and what’s changing, rationally and emotionally. And in which we explain the impact on the business and what they need to do.

The journey’s begun. There’s a fresh wind blowing. Aegon’s getting FutureFit.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: Dura Vermeer - Employer brand definition and implementation
projects.description: Dura Vermeer is one of the biggest construction companies in the Netherlands, and with a 160-year history of trailblazing projects, it’s nothing if not ambitious. Now it wants to become one of the top three pioneers in the construction sector within four years. It’s a challenge that will involve recruiting the best talent in the labour market to strengthen its 2,500-strong workforce. Finding entry level and mid-career professionals with talent, ambition and the right team spirit. The company asked us to help it develop a high impact employer brand.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: ActiZ - Image campaign ‘More than meets the eye’
projects.description:
How to get qualified nurses interested in elderly care? By letting them see and experience what the job really entails. Image campaign ‘More than meets the eye’ enables nursing students to experience the challenging situations in senior care first hand. The campaign website with an online experience has produced the desired exposure and image boost in almost no time at all.

Loads more qualified nursing professionals will be required if seniors are to continue receiving proper care in the future. Yet the elderly care sector’s image amongst many students is a bit boring. Image campaign ‘More than meets the eye’, created for trade organization ActiZ and the Dutch association of nursing and caring professionals (V&VN), is meant to change that. The three interactive films at www.daarzitmeerachter.nl accurately portray the complex situations in the elderly care sector. Students watching them are challenged to make a quick assessment of the situation and take the right decisions as the clock inevitably counts down. The stories are taken right from actual practice and are shown as true to life.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: Tata Steel - Communications/strategic branding advice
projects.description:
Tata Steel has asked us to create a clear, practical and creative way of bringing the Tata Steel business strategy to life amongst relevant stakeholders. That included the definition of an overarching strategic branding and communications approach that would hold everything together and make a clear connection with the overarching brand theme that has been developed.

To create alignment around the strategic approach we developed, we have tested it with different stakeholders including Internal Communications, Marketing, Recruitment and Public Affairs & Media Relations. In particular, we made an inventory of the challenges and opportunities the various stakeholders envision when it comes to implementing the new strategic approach. Next to that we have identified what the stakeholders we interviewed would need to bring the strategy to live. Based on the various sessions, we have designed the overarching communications advice, including recommendations for the actual implementation.

projects.title: Action - International employer brand definition and implementation
projects.description:
Working on the definition and implementation of the international employer brand of Action. 

Action, originally a Dutch company, is a rapidly growing international non-food discounter with more than 28,000 employees and more than 700 stores in the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, France, Luxembourg and Austria. The stores are stocked daily from the company’s three distribution centres in the Netherlands and France. The company’s international head office is located in The Netherlands.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: ING Bank - Cultural change program
projects.description: Working on the implementation of a cultural change program that helps align all employees with ING’s clear, bold and exciting purpose: to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and business. With more than 52,000 employees ING offers retail and wholesale banking services to customers in over 40 countries. Strengths include their well-known, strong brand with positive recognition from customers in many countries, strong financial position, omnichannel distribution strategy and an international network. Moreover, ING is currently among leaders in the Dow Jones Sustainability Index ‘Banks industry’ group.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: Brunel - Graduates marketing campaign, spring 2016
projects.description: Brunel serves two markets: supra-national industries and sectors, and specific countries. These include the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium and Canada, and it was in this context that Brunel came to PROOF. The company’s Dutch operation needed to fill 44 sales consultant positions with specialist university graduates. Brunel asked us to develop a campaign that would appeal to the best talent out there and further strengthen the company’s employer brand in general.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: Philips HealthTech - Global employee engagement initiative winter 2015/2016
projects.description:
2015 was a big year for Philips, with major changes going on internally, including a merger of two main businesses and different company cultures. 2016 will be an even bigger year in terms of historical importance and the requirement for everyone to deliver. To ensure that all employees are even more aligned and understand what Philips stands for, the HR department wanted to kick off the new year 2016 with a meaningful and engaging internal employee activation campaign.

The employee engagement campaign we developed was linked to the overarching theme Philips communicates: ‘Make THE difference’. We focussed on the individual team member and how and where he or she actually made and will make the difference as a person. With the output, a selfie and a short description uploaded via the central Intranet, we showed and share how the personal purpose of colleagues across the globe matches with the purpose of the company they work for.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: TomTom - Employee engagement program/ internal storytelling strategy
projects.description:
With the launch of the new Intranet ‘InTouch 2.0’ TomTom provides its team members around the world with access to a storytelling hub aimed at telling, sharing and showing the stories around and about TomTom’s purpose, the people working with TomTom and the products.

TomTom wanted InTouch 2.0 to be created and curated directly by their team members and asked us to help develop and maintain an impactful storytelling strategy within TomTom, and to help in the delivery (in its broadest sense) of content on their new platform. 

The approach we defined was implemented in February 2016. Since then, great content and fantastic stories have been shared by the employees and the TomTom teams really have embraced it; long may it continue :-)

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: OLX - Global employer brand definition and implementation
projects.description: Global Employer Brand strategy, design and implementation / roll-out for OLX. OLX, part of Naspers, is the world's leading online classifieds platform focused on high growth markets. Its success is built on having a clear purpose: to empower millions of people across the globe by helping them to connect and share their goods and services. Today OLX serves over 260 million unique users every month, generating over 11 billion monthly page views in more than 40 countries. OLX employs more than 1,000 committed employees in over 20 offices.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: Akzo Nobel - Code of Conduct
projects.description:
Akzo Nobel has updated its Code of Conduct – its rules… or guidelines is perhaps a better way of putting it … that shapes how the organisation behaves, interacts with itself and the outside world, and how it does business. Our challenge was to find a way of telling the Code of Conduct story to help embed it internationally and to find a way of positioning it with all stakeholders.

We adopted a number of different approaches (Miss Conduct! Awesome) before quickly settling on and developing an idea we called “The Story of being Human”.

The rationale was simple: we have a code of conduct because we’re human beings, we have the freedom to make choices, to do things our way and not necessarily yours.

The film tells the story of a mother (our Akzo Nobel employee), her son and the choices they make.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: Brunel - Graduates marketing campaign (focus: engineers)
projects.description: As part of the Get on Board concept, Brunel asked MADE BY JACK to develop an activation campaign. The aim was to position Brunel as an attractive employer amongst high potentials, so that students consider working for Brunel after they graduate. The activation campaign, “Access to more”, literally gave them more: entry to an exclusive student event during the Volvo Ocean Race Festival.

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: DLL - Internal storytelling platform ‘DLL Superfans’
projects.description: With the launch of the renewed DLL brand, DLL makes a promise to itself and the world: See what counts. To provide proof points for the See what counts claim, we have developed an internal storytelling program aimed at telling, sharing and showing the stories of DLL’s employees and  business partners. Project included development of strategic framework, concept and development of internal toolkit/ activation program

contributors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

projects.title: DLL - Business Ethics and Integrity initiative
projects.description:
Advise on a lean, integrated internal communications approach that is aimed at introducing and embedding the subject ‘Business Ethics and Integrity’ within DLL (by making optimal use of existing tools, initiatives, moments, links and launches). Next to that, design of relevant key message framework, including the rationale, for all internal communications around ‘Business ethics and integrity’.

About B&I at DLL	
Since a few years, DLL has been working on putting business ethics and integrity high on the business agenda. This resulted in the internal alignment initiative “Business ethics and integrity”. Objective of comms initiative: further increase awareness about and engagement with this subject amongst all employees as well as creating awareness for the tools that were developed.

authors.headline: Managing Director PROOF | Trusted Advisor - Specialised in employee and leadership alignment, transformation & change communications, strategy implementation and executive leadership positioning

profile_positions.description: Responsible for overall strategic direction, quality and performance, business growth, and client leadership advisory services.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
Member of PROOF’s management team, responsible for:

- Client management and integrated client services
- Stakeholder alignment for clients, as a trusted advisor and partner to top leadership 
- Agency reputation and relationship management, including positioning and marketing
- Overall agency management and business strategy design and implementation, together with the MD and Head of Operations.
profile_positions.title: Client Services Director | Principal Consultant
Head of Strategy

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the design, implementation and management of employer & internal branding, cultural change and HR communications strategies and related programs of PROOF's clients. 

Examples of activities include: 
- Definition, implementation and roll-out of global employer/internal brand and talent marketing and retention programs, based on long-term company/HR strategies and/or short-term needs and requirements of the business
- Corporate brand positioning, including development of (E)VP, creative concepts, compelling brand/change stories, communication strategies and paid/owned/earned media initiatives
- Design and implementation of stakeholder engagement & experience programs, including HR and leadership positioning/communications, business ethics & integrity initiatives and cultural change programs 
- Design and implementation of comms infrastructures, including pre- on- and offboarding experiences, storytelling platforms, analytics dashboards, and such

Overview of some of the clients I worked for:
Aegon Group, Akzo Nobel, Brunel, DLL, Dura Vermeer, HEINEKEN Europe, ING Netherlands, Intertrust Group, Rabobank Group, Rabobank NL, OLX Group, OLX Portugal, Philips (HealthTech), Tata Steel, Europe, TomTom, Vodafone
profile_positions.title: Strategy Consultant | International Programme Manager

profile_positions.description: As a member of the Dutch management team, setting up, leading and directing the agency’s digital unit in the Netherlands; managing the overall client relationship of several key accounts and drive their business forward through conversion-driven employer and internal branding, recruitment/ talent acquisition, HR communications and talent retention initiatives; strategic communications planning for several (international) accounts such as Dell, HEINEKEN, HP, Rabobank, PGGM, VTL and VU medical center.
profile_positions.title: Digital Director

profile_positions.description: Managing 360-degree employer & internal branding, recruitment/talent acquisition, HR communications and talent retention initiatives. From initiation to delivery phase. For clients such as DELL, HP, TNT Post, Deutsche Bank and VU medical center; strategic planning, budgeting/budget controlling and managing multidisciplinary teams; quality assurance; project P&L; resource management and planning; re-business development; managing and coaching the project management team.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description: Planning, developing and implementing Expatica’s integrated marketing strategy (for six countries); setting up, managing and leading the international marketing department (8 FTE); designing and implementing unit-related flows and procedures; managing external suppliers and agencies of Expatica; identifying and forming several strategic partnerships with relevant international media, organizations, local groups and clubs in six countries.
profile_positions.title: Head of Marketing (interim)

profile_positions.description: Managing the iizt studios (15 FTE), including P&L, in the Netherlands and in Poland; implementing and leading an efficient delivery organization; business/re-business development; key account management for Mercedes Benz, KLM, Expatica and Ernst & Young.
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager

profile_positions.description: Managing brand- and business-building campaigns; on-time/on-budget delivery of cross media campaigns, websites and portals for clients such as Pfizer, several Dutch ministries, Royal Dutch Air Force, Nashuatec/NRG and Batavus; implementing the tactical and operational business processes within the digital unit; re-business development.
profile_positions.title: Account Director

profile_positions.description: Setting up, managing and leading agency operations (10 FTE) in Düsseldorf, Germany; key project and account management for Philips Europe, Vodafone, World Press Photo and Volvo; managing the project teams in the agencies.
profile_positions.title: Country Branch Manager Framfab Germany

profile_positions.description: Managing online marketing programs for EURO2000 sponsors; designing proposals, sponsorship agreements and project plans; budget controlling; representing the organisation during industry-relevant events; sponsor relationship management.
profile_positions.title: Account Manager

profile_positions.description: Implementing marketing and sales programs for Germany, Switzerland, Austria and the UK; marketing sparring partner for the different country managers and various sales channel partners/resellers; promoting the global marketing plan in Germany, Switzerland, Austria and the UK; Marketing P&L controlling for the before mentioned countries.
profile_positions.title: European Marketing & Sales Co-ordinator (Germany, Switzerland, Austria & UK)

volunteer_experiences.description: Board member of the commissions of Arts “De Loodsen, Amsterdam”

Save the Children International (SCI) is in transition. They want to become a high performance organisation, where employees work more effectively and efficiently to ensure the most deprived children survive, learn and are protected. The aim is to fix, harmonise and share – wherever beneficial - processes, information and systems right across Save the Children. I help SCI with the definition, design and implementation of a change communications approach that will help SCI to become the high performance organisation they want, and need, to be.
